children.text: The steel beams and lintels have not been insulated, which will be reducing the effectiveness of the thermal performance.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3900 Bulk Thermal Insulation states in section 3.3.2 Thermal Bridging that
‘Thermal bridging occurs where more thermally conductive structural elements, fixings, etc. bridge the insulation layer providing a path for heat to flow through the insulation layer’
‘Structural materials that are very conductive to heat shall be either fully covered with insulation; or insulation shall be tightly abutted to structural member’ .
Additional insulation must be installed in these areas to ensure thermal performance prior to the plaster installation.
